intro: Thapsia nitida var. meridionalis, commonly known as the southern slender thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and inland environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
